title: 70s computer face similar to Amelia
content:
Hello there,   
New quiz similar to AMELIA type but still diferent   
   
Thank you   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22700.gif)

 [‹ (x) Steen & Strøm logo - Priori Sans {Dav, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/typophile.com/node/15553 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Embroidery, Inc. promotional piece - Impact, League Night, House Slant {Dan R, Dana, Dav} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/typophile.com/node/15540 "Go to next forum topic")
author: peru

comments.content:
Sorry Peru, I'm off to lunch, but [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/typographi.ca/000539.php#000539)'s a thread which   
might help you out.

I think from looking at the thread Yves linked, that the House [Outerspace](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=3009-FO&sub=view) was used, but some of the characters were reversed, like the M, Q and U. I think the N in your sample is an upside-down U from the same font.

I did some research, I was curious to know what this type of typefaces are caller, and the answer is "MICR" (short for Magnetic Ink Character Recognition).   
   
 [http://www.micrfonts.com/what.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/www.micrfonts.com/what.htm)   
   
And here is a page with links to MICR-fonts:   
   
 [http://cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/micr.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/micr.html)   
   
I wish my german wasn't so rusty: ("TYPOGRAFIE IM SCIENCE FICTION FILM")   
 [http://kisd.de/~marian/vordiplom/nt1/typefiction\_screen.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838/http:/kisd.de/~marian/vordiplom/nt1/typefiction_screen.pdf)

The sample posted by Peru is of a typeface I have long sought.   
   
It has been used in Sanrio's Little Twin Stars character logo:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22776.jpg)   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22777.gif)   
(Sorry, these were the best examples I could find online.)   
   
I have also seen it on the occasional old t-shirt. And it still exists today in Oakland, CA on the sign for Dave's Market on Park near-ish to MacArthur.   
   
I would LOVE to know what this typeface is, if it's available digitally, or if I can make a digital version.

do you mean this........   
   
   
   
   
David Hamuel   
   
   
 ![sam](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22783.gif)

similar feel, but not the same is   
COUNTDOWN, a PhotoLettering face   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071838im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23132.jpg)

Hi,   
   
Bj harvey where can i find this sunshine font you're posting ? Is there a similar release by a foundry ?
